description: The white-tinged sedge (Carex albicans) is an amazing plant species that is well suited for gardens and meadows alike. It features wispy grass-like foliage that is dark green with a white tinge on the edges of the blades. Its foliage grows in clumps reaching up to 24 inches in height which makes it a stunning focal point in a rock or island bed. Additionally, this species loves moist and wet soils allowing it to thrive in locations that others may not. Best of all, this sedge is a low-maintenance option that overall requires no pruning or deadheading thanks to its durable foliage.
